snippet: Mice have been the species of choice in the study of human diseases, but a new paper offered evidence that the mouse model has been misleading for sepsis, burns and trauma.
abstract: Research published in Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences shows evidence that using mice in studying human disease has been misleading for at least three major killers, including sepsis, burns and trauma.
lead_paragraph: Mice have been the species of choice in the study of human diseases, but a new paper offered evidence that the mouse model has been misleading for sepsis, burns and trauma.

headline.seo: Health Testing on Mice Is Found Misleading in Some Cases
headline.main: Mice Fall Short as Test Subjects for Some of Humans’ Deadly Ills
headline.print_headline: Mice Fall Short as Test Subjects for Deadly Illnesses

keywords.value: Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences
keywords.name: organizations
